newsitem.title: USA: Cisco profit jumps 77 percent on strong sales.
newsitem.headline: Cisco profit jumps 77 percent on strong sales.

text.p: Cisco Systems Inc. said Tuesday its fiscal first quarter profit from operations rose 77 percent, reflecting strong sales of its computer networking equipment.

The company, which makes devices that control the flow of information between computers in a network, said earnings before gains and charges rose to $320.8 million, or 47 cents a share, for the three months ended Oct. 26, from $181.4 million or 28 cents in the same quarter a year ago.

Net income for the quarter, after taking into account a $174.6 million charge for the acquisition of Telebit Corp. and a $55.1 million gain from the sale of a minority investment, totaled $180.9 million, or 26 cents a share. Revenue jumped 80 percent to $1.43 billion from $798.3 million.
San Jose, Calif.-based Cisco, the world's biggest computer networking company and a technology bellwether on Wall Street, reported its results after the market closed.
For the day, the stock had gained $1.125 to close at $61.75. After the earnings release, the shares slipped 25 cents to $61.50 in after-hour trading.
Cisco attributed the rise in operating profits to strong sales across all its product lines.
